# Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles Recipe | King Arthur Baking (www.kingarthurbaking.com)

<https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/classic-sourdough-waffles-or-pancakes-recipe>

## Description

Crisp, feathery light waffles with a delightful, mild tang.

![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles](/sites/default/files/styles/hero_lg/public/2021-10/classic-sourdough-pancakes-or-waffles_marquee.jpg?itok=x_jewoIG){loading="eager" width="1360" height="810"}

Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles

1.  [Recipes](/recipes)
2.  [Pancakes & Waffles](/recipes/pancakes-waffles)

# Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles

Recipe by [PJ Hamel](/author/pj-hamel){hreflang="en"}

[](#review-section){.reviews__jumplink}

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
932 Reviews
4.7 out of 5 stars

Share

-   [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
    Share on Facebook](#){.share__btn .share__btn--facebook .js-kaf-share-button-facebook}
-   [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
    Share by Email](#){.share__btn .share__btn--email .js-kaf-share-button-email}
-   [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
    Share on Pinterest](#){.share__btn .share__btn--pinterest .js-kaf-share-button-pinterest}
-   [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
    Share on Twitter](#){.share__btn .share__btn--twitter .js-kaf-share-button-twitter}
-   [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)Share on Linkedin](#){.share__btn .share__btn--linkedin .js-kaf-share-button-linkedin}

With their mild tang, sourdough pancakes are a tasty change from your usual breakfast short stack. You might worry that their flavor will be strong enough to clash with syrup or your other favorite toppings, but no worries: pancakes made with sourdough starter simply taste a bit richer and more nuanced than the norm. And sourdough waffles? They\'re perfect for either a drizzle of maple or as the base for savory toppings like fried chicken. \
 

Prep

42 mins

Total

12 hrs 42 mins

Yield

about 2 dozen medium pancakes or 1 dozen 8\" waffles

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyBlbmFibGUtYmFja2dyb3VuZD0ibmV3IDAgMCAxNSAxNSIgdmlld2JveD0iMCAwIDE1IDE1IiB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjxwYXRoIGQ9Im04IDd2LTdoLTF2N2gtN3YxaDd2N2gxdi03aDd2LTF6Ij48L3BhdGg+PC9zdmc+)Save Recipe](/recipebox){.btn .btn--save .js-kaf-recipe-box-add recipe-id="10721" recipe-uuid="da1120b6-6a7f-427b-aaf4-b12522ff9683" aria-label="Save Recipe: Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles"}

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
Print

![Classic Sourdough Waffles or Pancakes - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/recipe_legacy/93-3-large.jpg?itok=9X7IS2tG){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/2021-10/Sourdough-Pancakes-Waffles_STEP8.jpg?itok=a-bjUYJ9){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/2021-10/classic-sourdough-pancakes-or-waffles_alt.jpg?itok=bHKuPDSv){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![Classic Sourdough Waffles or Pancakes - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/recipe_legacy/93-3-large.jpg?itok=9X7IS2tG){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/2021-10/Sourdough-Pancakes-Waffles_STEP8.jpg?itok=a-bjUYJ9){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles - select to zoom](/sites/default/files/styles/featured_image/public/2021-10/classic-sourdough-pancakes-or-waffles_alt.jpg?itok=bHKuPDSv){loading="eager" width="960" height="636"}

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

*Cook Mode* Prevent your screen from turning off.

#### Ingredients

Overnight sponge

-   2 cups (240g) [King Arthur Unbleached All-Purpose Flour](https://shop.kingarthurbaking.com/items/unbleached-all-purpose-flour){.product-modal data-name="All-Purpose Flour" sku="301050" price="$6.95"}
-   1 cup (227g) sourdough starter, unfed/discard
-   2 tablespoons (28g) granulated sugar
-   2 cups (454g) buttermilk

Batter

-   all of the overnight sponge
-   2 large eggs
-   1/4 cup (50g) vegetable oil or 4 tablespoons (57g) butter, melted
-   3/4 teaspoon salt
-   1 teaspoon baking soda

[Nutrition Information](/nutritional-info/10721){.btn .btn--secondary .use-ajax rel="nofollow" aria-haspopup="dialog" dialog-type="modal" dialog-options="{\"width\":\"90%\", \"dialogClass\":\"kaf-modal\"}"}

[Hide images](){#recipe__media-toggle .recipe__media-toggle aria-label="Hide images and videos in recipe steps"}

#### Instructions

1.  **To make the overnight sponge:** Stir down your refrigerated starter, and remove 1 cup (227g). *Note: This is a good opportunity to feed the remainder, if necessary.*

2.  In a large bowl, stir together the 1 cup (227g) unfed starter, flour, sugar, and buttermilk.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 2](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-2.gif){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

3.  Cover and let rest at cool room temperature (about 65°F to 70°F) for about 12 hours, or overnight.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 3](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-3_0.jpg){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

4.  **To make the batter:** In a small bowl or mixing cup, beat together the eggs, and oil or butter. Add to the overnight sponge, stirring just to combine.

5.  Add the salt and baking soda, stirring to combine. The batter will expand and may bubble a bit.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 5](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-5.gif){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

6.  **To make pancakes:** Pour the batter by the 1/4-cupful onto a preheated, lightly greased griddle. Cook until bubbles form and pop on the top side of the pancakes, then turn over and cook until browned underneath.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 6](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-6_1.jpg){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

7.  **To make waffles:** Pour the batter onto your preheated, greased waffle iron, and bake according to the manufacturer\'s instructions. Repeat with the remaining batter.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 7](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-7_0.jpg){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

8.  Serve pancakes or waffles immediately, with your favorite toppings; or hold in a warm oven until ready to serve.

    ![Classic Sourdough Pancakes or Waffles -- Step 8](/sites/default/files/2021-10/step-8_0.jpg){width="512" height="342" loading="lazy"}

9.  **Storage instructions:** Store any leftovers in the refrigerator for a day or two; freeze for longer storage.

#### Tips from our Bakers

-   Step by step by delicious step, our blog offers all the details for turning your discard starter into the best waffles you\'ll ever enjoy: [Sourdough waffles, the ideal use for your discard starter.](https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/blog/2019/06/27/sourdough-waffles)

-   For whole-grain waffles, substitute our [white whole wheat flour](/shop/landing.jsp?go=DetailDefault&id=3311) or [Premium whole wheat flour](/shop/landing.jsp?go=DetailDefault&id=3015) for some or all of the all-purpose flour.

-   Don't have any starter? Here's a recipe for [homemade sourdough starter](https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/sourdough-starter-recipe). If you\'re making it from scratch, you\'ll need to feed it for 5 to 7 days before it's ready for baking. Want a head start? Purchase our [classic fresh sourdough starter](https://shop.kingarthurbaking.com/items/classic-fresh-sourdough-starter) --- it'll be ready for baking soon after it arrives at your door. Looking for tips, techniques, and all kinds of great information about sourdough baking? Find what you need in our [sourdough baking guide](https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/learn/guides/sourdough).

-   Can these pancakes and waffles be made gluten-free? Absolutely. Make sure to use a [gluten-free starter](https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/gluten-free-sourdough-starter-recipe); and substitute our [Gluten-Free Measure for Measure Flour](https://shop.kingarthurbaking.com/items/gluten-free-measure-for-measure-flour) for the all-purpose flour called for in the recipe.
